C++11: Standard Library

Monday, April 13, 2015

Overview

From vectors to maps to output streams, the C++ standard library has everything you want or need. This post will contain small snippets of different classes that you can find in the std. You can find more documentation here.

Content

Vector

 1 #include <vector>
 2 
 3 std::vector<int> v;
 4 v.push_back(3);   // [3]
 5 v.push_back(6);   // [3,6]
 6 v.pop_back();     // [3]
 7 v.push_back(7);   // [3,7]
 8 v.push_back(9);   // [3,7,9]
 9 std::cout << v[2] // 7
10 
11 // Deletes the second element (g[1])
12 std::vector<int> g = {2,5,8,11,14};
13 g.erase(g.begin() + 1); // [2,8,11,14]
14 
15 // Deletes the 2nd through 3rd elements (vec[1], vec[2])
16 g.erase(g.begin() + 1, g.begin() + 3);
17 
18 // size
19 std::vector<int>::size_type size=3;
20 
21 // iterator
22 for(std::vector<int>::iterator it = v.begin(); it != v.end(); ++it) {
23     /* std::cout << *it; ... */
24 }
25 
26 // reverse iterator
27 for (std::vector<int>::reverse_iterator it = v.rbegin(); it != v.rend(); ++it) {
28     // std::cout << *it; ...
29 }
30 
31 // Ranged for-loop
32 for (const auto& item : g) {
33     // std::cout << item; ....
34 }
35 
36 // indecies
37 for(std::vector<int>::size_type i = 0; i != v.size(); i++) {
38     /* std::cout << someVector[i]; ... */
39 }

Map

 1 #include <map>
 2 //Map is a balanced BST
 3 
 4 // or std::map<string, int> m = { {"first", 1}, {"second", 2}, {"third", 3} };
 5 std::map<string, int> m;
 6 
 7 m["first"] = 1;
 8 m["second"] = 2;
 9 m["third"] = 3;
10 
11 std::pair<string,int> p("forth", 4);
12 m.insert(p); // { "first":1, "second":2, "third":3, "forth":4 }
13 
14 // auto = std::pair<string,int>::iterator
15 for (auto it = m.begin(); it != m.end(); ++it) {
16     std::cout << it->first << " " << it->second << std::endl;
17 }
18 /*
19 first 1
20 second 2
21 third 3
22 forth 4
23 */
24 
25 int forth = m["forth"];
26 // forth = 4
27 
28 // it is an iterator that points to the pair whose key is "second"
29 // the find method runs in O(log n) time since it's a BST
30 auto it = mymap.find("second");
31 m.erase(it);        // { "first":1, "third":3, "forth":4 }
32 m.erase("forth");   // { "first":1, "third":3 }

Set

 1 #include <set> 
 2 
 3 // or std::set<std::string> s = {"first", "second", "third", "forth"};
 4 std::set<std::string> s;
 5 s.insert("first");
 6 s.insert("second");
 7 s.insert("third");
 8 s.insert("forth");
 9 
10 auto it = s.find("second");
11 s.erase(it);        // { "first", "third", "forth" }
12 s.erase("forth");   // { "first", "third" }

Tuple

1 auto my_tuple = std::make_tuple(5, 6, 7);
2 
3 std::cout << std::get<0>(my_tuple); // 5
4 std::cout << std::get<1>(my_tuple); // 6
5 std::cout << std::get<2>(my_tuple); // 7
